dialog.original_question: Why did Gavin leave Titãs?
dialog.answer: Gavin stated that he was physically and mentally exhausted because of the Titas tours and album releases.

dialog.original_question: Did they replace him with anyone?
dialog.answer: Yes, Drummer Mario Fabre, who has remained with the Titas since then as a session member.

dialog.original_question: What was Louison Bobet's personality like?
dialog.answer: The most striking feature of Louison Bobet was his ambition to behave like a Hollywood matinée idol, a sort of David Niven character in a dinner suit tuxedo.

dialog.original_question: How was he a little moody?
dialog.answer: The British professional Brian Robinson called Louison Bobet a private man and a little moody and said he would sulk if things went wrong.

dialog.original_question: Did people not like him for his personality?
dialog.answer: Géminiani says Bobet's diffident and elegant manner made him less popular even in his own Brittany than the more rustic, forthright manners of other Breton people such as Jean Robic.

dialog.original_question: Who else had something to say about his personality?
dialog.answer: French journalist René de Latour said of Louison Bobet in Sporting Cyclist that he didn't look good on a bike and that he had the legs of a football player.

dialog.original_question: What songs did Max Martin produce with Cheiron and Denniz PoP?
dialog.answer: In 1993, Max Martin was hired by Cheiron Studios and spent time learning the basics, before the first production collaboration between PoP and Martin: Wish You Were Here in 1994.

dialog.original_question: What artist sang Wish You Were Here?
dialog.answer: Rednex sang the song Wish You Were Here“

dialog.original_question: Did Bobby Jindal deliver the Republican response to February 2009 Barack Obama speech to joint session of Congress?
dialog.answer: On February 24, 2009, Bobby Jindal delivered the official Republican response to President Obama's address to a joint session of Congress.

dialog.original_question: Was the address extremely critical?
dialog.answer: President Obama discussed the recently passed $787 billion American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 as well as the Troubled Assets Relief Program, the state and future of the economy.

dialog.original_question: What was the most profitable fur at the beginning of the 18th century in the North American fur trade?
dialog.answer: At the beginning of the 18th century, more organized violence than in previous decades occurred between the Native Americans involved in the deerskin trade and white settlers.

dialog.original_question: What happened as a result of the organized violence between Native Americans and white settlers?
dialog.answer: More organized violence than in previous decades occurred between the Native Americans involved in the deerskin trade and white settlers, most famously the Yamasee War.

dialog.original_question: What impact did the Yamasee War and other fighting have on the fur trade?
dialog.answer: This uprising of Indians against fur traders almost wiped out the European colonists in the southeast.

dialog.original_question: When did Helen Reddy make a brief comeback?
dialog.answer: In 2012, Reddy decided to return to performing after being buoyed by the warm reception she received when she sang at her sister's 80th birthday party.

dialog.original_question: How many shows did she do after her comeback?
dialog.answer: On 12 July 2012, Reddy returned to the musical stage at Croce's Jazz Bar and for a benefit concert for the arts at St. Genevieve High School

dialog.original_question: Did she do any other shows after St. Genevieve High School?
dialog.answer: Reddy performed at the Paramount nightclub at The Crown & Anchor in Provincetown on 13 October 2013.

dialog.original_question: Did she perform anywhere after that?
dialog.answer: She performed two nights at Catalina Supper Club, Los Angeles in November 2014, shortly after her 73rd birthday.

dialog.original_question: What did she sing at the Womens March?
dialog.answer: an a cappella version of her song, I Am Woman“

dialog.original_question: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
dialog.answer: She maintains that she still refuses to sing Leave Me Alone (Ruby Red Dress)“

dialog.original_question: Why does she refuse to sing Leave Me Alone?
dialog.answer: she dislikes the monotony of the repeated chorus

dialog.original_question: Did she have any songs that she preferred to sing during her comeback?
dialog.answer: She explained, One of the reasons that I'm coming back to singing is because I'm not doing the greatest hits. I'm doing the songs that I always loved.“

dialog.original_question: where is the thymus gland in a cow
dialog.answer: Cows have more than one thymus, in their neck and by their heart.

dialog.original_question: what is the purpose of the gland
dialog.answer: Within the thymus, T cells mature. T cells are critical to the adaptive immune system, where the body adapts specifically to foreign invaders.

dialog.original_question: Where were Ted DiBiase's accomplishments in 1983?
dialog.answer: Ted DiBiase entered All Japan Pro Wrestling (AJPW) in 1983. He won the NWA United National Championship on October 14, 1983.

dialog.original_question: What more followed this victory?
dialog.answer: Three months later, on January 28, 1984, Ted DiBiase lost the title to Michael Hayes.

dialog.original_question: When did he fight again?
dialog.answer: In August 1985, Ted DiBiase formed a tag team with fellow gaijin Stan Hansen, and the two became the PWF Tag Team Champions.

dialog.original_question: What was the highlight of this team's performance?
dialog.answer: Later that year, Ted DiBiase and Stan Hansen entered the 1985 World's Strongest Tag Determination League and would emerge victorious, finishing in first place with 7 points.

dialog.original_question: What happened in 1987?
dialog.answer: In August 1985, Ted DiBiase formed a tag team with fellow gaijin Stan Hansen, and the two became the PWF Tag Team Champions.

dialog.original_question: What was significant about 1993?
dialog.answer: In September 1993, Ted DiBiase returned to AJPW and reformed his team with Stan Hansen.

dialog.original_question: lactic acid production would be the fate of which energy system
dialog.answer: the ultimate fate of the lactate is oxidation to ATP

dialog.original_question: what does the energy system consist of
dialog.answer: As the name suggests the ATP-PC system consists of adenosine triphosphate and phosphocreatine.

dialog.original_question: Where did Émilie du Châtelet go to school?
dialog.answer: Du Châtelet's education has been the subject of much speculation, but nothing is known with certainty.

dialog.original_question: Did she have a mentor or tutor?
dialog.answer: When she was small, her father arranged training for her in activities such as fencing and riding, and as she grew older, he brought tutors to the house for her.

dialog.original_question: Who else did she learn from?
dialog.answer: Du Châtelet's father Louis-Nicolas, recognizing her early brilliance, arranged for Bernard Le Bovier de Fontenelle to visit and talk about astronomy with her when she was 10 years old.

dialog.original_question: How did she get started in philosophy?
dialog.answer: In addition to producing famous translations of works by authors such as Bernard Mandeville and Isaac Newton, Du Châtelet wrote a number of significant philosophical essays, letters and books.

dialog.original_question: Any other famous philosophers she worked with?
dialog.answer: She had a well-known collaboration and romantic involvement with Voltaire.

dialog.original_question: Did she ever attend a formal school?
dialog.answer: Du Châtelet's education has been the subject of much speculation, but nothing is known with certainty.

dialog.original_question: who was chris gaines in relation to Garth Brooks
dialog.answer: Garth Brooks took on the alter ego of Chris Gaines, a fictitious rock and roll musician and character for an upcoming film titled The Lamb.

dialog.original_question: did he release any music as Chris Gaines
dialog.answer: In October 1999, the film's pre-release soundtrack, Garth Brooks in ... The Life of Chris Gaines, was released to much public criticism.

dialog.original_question: how did his fans feel about Gaines
dialog.answer: The majority of the American public was either bewildered, or completely unreceptive to the idea of Garth Brooks portraying a rock and roll musician.

dialog.original_question: Did he win any awards for work as Gaines
dialog.answer: Despite the less-than-spectacular response, Garth Brooks gained his first Billboard Top 40 pop single in Lost in You. The album was later certified Double Platinum by the RIAA.

dialog.original_question: what is the meaning of the name barbara
dialog.answer: Barbara is from the Greek barbaros meaning foreign or strange, traveler from a foreign land.

dialog.original_question: what about Matthew
dialog.answer: Matthew is a Greek form of the Hebrew name Mattityahu, meaning gift of YAHWEH.

dialog.original_question: what about Elizabeth
dialog.answer: Elizabeth is a feminine given name derived from a form of the Hebrew name Elisheva, meaning My God is an oath or My God is abundance.

dialog.original_question: how about Travis
dialog.answer: The meaning of the name Travis is crossing; crossroads; toll gate.

dialog.original_question: how about Justin

dialog.original_question: Who won the Women's single at Wimbledon 2019

dialog.original_question: how long was the match

dialog.original_question: What is Caddoan Mississippian regarding Mississippian culture?
dialog.answer: The Caddoan Mississippian area is a regional variant of the Mississippian culture.

dialog.original_question: What type of variant of the Mississippian culture?
dialog.answer: The climate in this area was drier than areas in the eastern woodlands, and the lower population on the plains may have meant fewer neighboring competing chiefdoms to contend with.

dialog.original_question: Why was Vladimir Nabokov in Berlin?
dialog.answer: In 1920, Nabokov's family moved to Berlin, where his father set up the émigré newspaper Rul' (Rudder). Nabokov followed them to Berlin two years later, after completing studies at Cambridge.

dialog.original_question: What happened after that
dialog.answer: Nabokov had become a recognised poet and writer within the émigré community and published under the nom de plume V. Sirin.

dialog.original_question: What was unique about Lawrence Alma-Tadema's style?
dialog.answer: Lawrence Alma-Tadema's works are remarkable for the way in which flowers, textures and hard reflecting substances, like metals, pottery, and especially marble, are painted.

dialog.original_question: Was there anything else unique?
dialog.answer: Lawrence Alma-Tadema was a perfectionist. He worked assiduously to make the most of his paintings, often repeatedly reworking parts of paintings before becoming satisfied by his own high standards.

dialog.original_question: Who were his influences?
dialog.answer: By 1871 Lawrence Alma-Tadema met and befriended most of the major Pre-Raphaelite painters and it was in part due to their influence that shows in his style.

dialog.original_question: When was Gentle Giant originally formed?

dialog.original_question: What did Terry Gilliam do in the movie Monty Python?
dialog.answer: Terry Gilliam was a part of Monty Python's Flying Circus from its outset, credited at first as an animator and later as a full member.

dialog.original_question: what did he animate?

dialog.original_question: Who else was involved in Monty Python?
dialog.answer: Monty Python’s Flying Circus consisted of Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones, Michael Palin and Terry Gilliam, aka the Pythons.

dialog.original_question: what is the job of a motor neuron
dialog.answer: A single motor neuron may innervate many muscle fibres and a muscle fibre can undergo many action potentials in the time taken for a single muscle twitch.

dialog.original_question: where is the neuron located
dialog.answer: A motor neuron is a neuron whose cell body is located in the motor cortex, brainstem or the spinal cord.

dialog.original_question: what types are there
dialog.answer: There are two types of motor neuron – upper motor neurons and lower motor neurons.

dialog.original_question: what is an upper
dialog.answer: Upper motor neurons are found in the cerebral cortex and brainstem and carry information down to activate interneurons and lower motor neurons, which in turn directly signal muscles.

dialog.original_question: what is a lower
dialog.answer: Lower motor neurons are motor neurons located in either the anterior grey column, anterior nerve roots or the cranial nerve nuclei of the brainstem and cranial nerves with motor function.

dialog.original_question: What were some of Joe Biden's early senate activities?

dialog.original_question: Was he successful in this?
dialog.answer: In mid-1974, freshman Senator Joe Biden was named one of the 200 Faces for the Future by Time magazine.

dialog.original_question: How many bricklayers were there?
dialog.answer: Six bricklayers can lay 24 bricks in half an hour. How many bricks can 12 bricklayers lay in two hours? 192 (Each bricklayer lays four bricks in half an hour, or eight bricks in an hour. That is 16 bricks in two hours times 12 bricklayers who can lay 16 bricks each.)

dialog.original_question: Who was ralph?
dialog.answer: Ralph was an alligator

dialog.original_question: How many brothers did he have?
dialog.answer: Ralph had three brothers

dialog.original_question: What were their names?
dialog.answer: Henry, Larry, and Thomas.

dialog.original_question: Did they like the water?
dialog.answer: But none of Ralph's three brothers liked to play in the water

dialog.original_question: Who would chase Ralph?
dialog.answer: Henry

dialog.original_question: Why?
dialog.answer: but the meanest of them all was Henry

dialog.original_question: Were they all mean?
dialog.answer: They were very mean brothers,

dialog.original_question: did Henry do anything about it?
dialog.answer: Ralph thought of a great idea.

dialog.original_question: What did Ralph do?
dialog.answer: trick Henry into thinking one side of the lake was scary.

dialog.original_question: how?
dialog.answer: Ralph dressed up in a spooky costume and waited for Henry to swim over to the side of the lake.

dialog.original_question: and then?
dialog.answer: started making spooky sounds and scared Henry back to the other side of the lake.

dialog.original_question: What did henry do?
dialog.answer: Henry back to the other side of the lake.

dialog.original_question: did he ever come back?
dialog.answer: Henry was so scared he never came to the other side of the lake again

dialog.original_question: How did ralph feel then?
dialog.answer: free to splash around in peace.

dialog.original_question: did he enjoy splashing around?
dialog.answer: Ralph was an alligator that loved to splash around in the water.
